page.title: 11North east of Hauxton
page.content:
In this 1km square the land use was mainly arable containing many fields and scattered farmhouses.
There were a number of residential places consisting mainly of houses and flats, with also some office blocks and a very large Jewson warehouse.
There was also a sports field, which was the only place of recreation. The river Cam also ran through this square.
In the adjacent sqaure the land use was also arable, again there were scattered farmhouses. The railway also runs through this square.
